security_audit.summary: All 777 static findings are false positives. The detected 'eval()' calls are legitimate PyTorch model.eval() methods for evaluation mode, not dynamic code execution. The 'external_commands' findings are markdown code blocks using backtick formatting. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' flags are triggered by documentation mentioning algorithm names. The 'certificate/key files' flags misidentify error messages referencing TEMPLATES.keys(). No actual security threats identified in this legitimate PyTorch Geometric ML skill.

content.user_title: Build Graph Neural Networks with PyTorch Geometric
content.value_statement: Graph Neural Networks power modern applications like drug discovery, social network analysis, and recommendation systems. This skill provides ready-to-use templates and documentation for implementing GNNs with PyTorch Geometric.
actual_capabilities: Implement GNN architectures including GCN, GAT, and GraphSAGE
Load and process benchmark datasets like Cora, PubMed, and TUDataset
Perform node classification, graph classification, and link prediction
Apply transforms and pooling operations for graph data
Train models on CPU or GPU with mini-batch processing
Generate boilerplate code templates for common GNN architectures
limitations: Does not provide pre-trained model weights or trained checkpoints
Does not include custom dataset loading beyond supported formats
Requires PyTorch and torch_geometric library installation
Does not cover graph generation or graph matching algorithms

use_cases.title: Build Molecular Property Predictors
use_cases.description: Train GNNs on molecular graphs to predict drug properties, toxicity, and binding affinity for drug discovery.

use_cases.title: Create Citation Network Classifiers
use_cases.description: Implement node classification on citation networks like Cora and PubMed for paper categorization and recommendation.

use_cases.title: Analyze Social Networks
use_cases.description: Apply graph attention and sampling techniques to large social networks for community detection and influence analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Basic GNN Model
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a simple graph neural network
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a Graph Convolutional Network for node classification on the Cora dataset using PyTorch Geometric. Include training loop and evaluation.

prompt_templates.title: Graph Classification
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GraphSAGE model for graph classification on the ENZYMES dataset using global mean pooling and DataLoader.

prompt_templates.title: Attention Mechanism
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a Graph Attention Network (GAT) with multi-head attention for citation network classification.

prompt_templates.title: Large-Scale Training
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to use NeighborLoader for training GNNs on large-scale graphs with mini-batch processing and neighbor sampling.

output_examples.input: Create a GCN model for the Cora citation network
Load the TUDataset for graph classification
Use attention mechanisms in my GNN

best_practices: Use model.eval() and torch.no_grad() during inference to disable gradients and ensure deterministic behavior.
Apply NeighborLoader with appropriate num_neighbors for large graphs to enable efficient mini-batch training.
Save models using torch.save() with state_dict for efficient checkpointing and reproducibility.
anti_patterns: Avoid training on full graphs without sampling for large networks as this causes memory overflow.
Do not forget to set model.train() during training phases and model.eval() during evaluation.
Avoid hardcoding dataset paths; use root parameter with temporary directories for dataset caching.

faq.question: What is PyTorch Geometric?
faq.answer: PyTorch Geometric (PyG) is a library for deep learning on graphs, extending PyTorch with GNN implementations.

faq.question: What GNN architectures are supported?
faq.answer: GCN, GAT, GraphSAGE, GraphConv, GINConv, TransformerConv and 40+ other layer types are available.

faq.question: What datasets can I load?
faq.answer: Planetoid (Cora, CiteSeer, PubMed), TUDataset, Coauthor, Amazon, and many others for benchmarking.

faq.question: How do I handle large graphs?
faq.answer: Use NeighborLoader for neighbor sampling and mini-batch processing to train on graphs with millions of nodes.

faq.question: Can I do molecular property prediction?
faq.answer: Yes, use molecular datasets with GINConv or other message passing layers for drug discovery and chemistry tasks.

faq.question: What transforms are available?
faq.answer: Node transforms (normalization,PCA), edge transforms (distance, adding edges), and graph transforms (connected components).
